title: City of St. Marys, Kansas Library

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: City of St. Marys, Kansas Library
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any communications (including, but not limited to, emails, text messages, letters, memoranda, voicemails, video messages, audio messages, or social media messages) to or from any member of the St. Marys City Commission (including the Mayor and Vice-Mayor) which relate to the Pottawatomie Wabaunsee Regional Library. This request includes public records wherever they may be found, including communications that were sent, received, or stored on any device, service, plan, or system, whether or not provided or controlled by the City of St. Marys. This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: FBI Correspondence

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails, all written correspondence, LAUSD representatives exchanged with FBI pertaining to a claim and the investigation of a claim published in Venice Senior High's The Oarsman in an article titled "FBI Investigating Predators Targeting Online Accounts of Venice Students", published March 05, 2021.

The link to the specific claim of cyber crime is below.

This request includes any correspondence sent in reply and any possible initial messages sent by FBI to LAUSD in regards to a claim or any suspicion inspiring the following article in question:
https://veniceoarsman.com/10832/news/fbi-investigating-predators-targeting-online-student-accounts/
As such, the claim that individuals received solicitation for money, images, in a way that constitutes a crime was committed, communication records to local law enforcement, private investigators, FBI employees/agents/contractors should be provided, whatsoever record exists.
To successfully provide your record of messages exchanged between LAUSD (Los Angeles Unified School District) and FBI agents, employees, IC3, any contractor, investigator, police officer, names of any known victims proven to be a minor should be redacted sequentially as needed to provide the compiled records to the public.

In regards to the investigation detailed within the article referenced:
-I additionally request record of websites where alleged victim's accounts were located, and where accounts were searched for, and by whom. I am requesting record of when the accounts were accessed during an investigation, and when the accounts ceased being accessed totally by investigators. It would prove helpful to know when passwords were exchanged and how by providing correspondence record as they pertain.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: Wahkiakum County PRA request
communications.communication:
Hi, I'm Dan Bigelow, prosecutor of Wahkiakum County. This morning I received two faxed requests from you for Brady lists that my office maintains, and this message is intended to answer both of them.
Wahkiakum County has seven sworn officers and none of them have any Brady material, so I guess you could either say I don't have a Brady list or that my Brady list has nobody on it. The Washington State Patrol has officers patrolling the county and I pay attention to the WSP's Brady updates, but nobody they have provided an update on has impinged on a case of mine, so I have not added anyone from WSP to a Brady list, either. It's empty - or it doesn't exist - whichever one checks your boxes better!
I hope this satisfies your inquiry. If not, please get in touch. Have a great day!

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (July 2023) (Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
Hi Rose,

I’m going to forward your request to our public records officer to process through our public records portal.

But just to make sure we’re on the same page, and by way of clarification of your request, I want to give you an idea what we have.

We don’t have a “Brady List” per se.  We are a small jurisdiction, and we only have one LEO employee for whom we have and disclose potential impeachment information (“Brady” disclosures).  We have a memo we share that summarizes the potential impeachment information.  We do not maintain lists or information for state employees unless they regularly work in our jurisdiction.  I’m unaware of any current state employees (WSP, WDFW, etc.) that work regularly in our jurisdiction that have potential impeachment disclosures.

So, we can send you the name of the SCSO employee that would be on our “list” (if we had a list), or we can just send you the memo we disclose to defense counsel.

Let me know what you prefer, and we’ll get your request processed ASAP.  Also, let me know if, with that information, it changes the scope of your request.

Sincerely,

adam

Adam N. Kick
Prosecuting Attorney
Skamania County
509-427-3790

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (July 2023) (Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
Hi Rose,

This request appears to be identical to a request you made a few hours later, which I just responded to in  order to clarify.  Can I assume these are the same request and disregard this one?

adam

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (July 2023) (Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
Hi Adam,

Sorry about that! If you received duplicate emails, please process them as the same request.

Yes, please send me the memo that you disclose to defense counsel.

Thank you,
Rose

title: FOIA - FBI - William Durant

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - William Durant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning William James Durant (November 5, 1885 – November 7, 1981) - American historian and philosopher (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Will_Durant )

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Police Public Records Request :: P107615-071123
communications.communication:
Dear Barry Diamond: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of City of Cincinnati. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Ohio Sunshine Law.  Your request was received in this office on 7/11/2023 and given the reference number P107615-071123 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all email communications between any member of your agency and any employee or contractor of Motorola Solutions or any related business entity between the years of 2018 and 2023, to include but not be exclusive to emails from the @motorolasolutions.com domain.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Barry Diamond

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcincinnati-police-department-674%252Fcommunications-with-motorola-solutions-cincinnati-police-department-149065%252F%253Femail%253DCPDRecords%252540cincinnati-oh.gov&url_auth_token=AAAatEzesKQOe49YzwlyvIT2J4g%3A1qJP2q%3AwDX6dREokHFHe3jM2X9erfEb5DBRNnktnTDwraxIjUc 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Ohio Sunshine Law does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. If this is your first time logging into your account, please select "If you don't know or have forgotten your password - CLICK HERE".  This is located beneath the "Submit" button on the front login page. 
 
Again, thank you for using the Records Request Center. 
City of Cincinnati

title: Education for ICE detainees

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Education for ICE detainees
communications.communication:
July 11, 2023

Patrick C. Lee
General Counsel
Plymouth County Sheriff
24 Long Pond Road
Plymouth, MA 02360

Dear Mr. Lee, 

This is a request under the Massachusetts Public Record Law (M.G.L. Chapter 66, Section 10). I am requesting that I be provided a copy of the following records: 

1. Any policies or procedures that dictate what educational and programmatic services are offered to Federal Detainees and ICE Detainees within Plymouth Sheriff’s custody.

2. Records that indicate what educational services (including but not limited to K-12 education, Special Education, Vocational Education, High School Equivalency, or post-secondary education), if any, were provided to federal detainees and ICE detainees  from January 2021 through the date that this request is responded to. We request records that show the age of the detainee who received educational services, and the type of educational services provided. If no educational services were provided during this time, a statement to that effect would be appreciated.


The Public Records law requires you to provide me with a written response within 10 business days.  I would appreciate an electronic response via email.  Thank you, in advance.

Sincerely, 

Joshua Dankoff
Director of Strategic Initiatives
Citizens for Juvenile Justice
44 School St. Suite 415,
Boston, MA 02108
617-338-1050

title: Records for Rocky Herculano Martinez Arrests

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Records for Rocky Herculano Martinez Arrests
communications.communication:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: June 2, 2023

Pueblo Police Department
200 S Main St.
Pueblo, CO 81003

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Police Report, Dashcam, Body-Worn Camera, and 911 Audio

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of the following records held by the Pueblo Police Department pertaining to the following arrest incidents involving Rocky Herculano Martinez:

Date and Time: May 10, 2023, at 22:00
Arrest: Rocky Herculano Martinez
Charge: 1st Degree Criminal Trespass (Dwelling Occupied)
Location: 1700-BLK Constitution Rd

Date and Time: May 10, 2023, at 22:15
Arrest: Rocky Herculano Martinez
Charge: 1st Degree Criminal Trespass (Dwelling Occupied)
Location: 2000-BLK E 12th St

For the purpose of this request, I kindly request the following records related to each arrest incident:

The official incident report(s) related to each arrest, including any supplementary reports or narratives detailing the circumstances and events leading to the arrest.

Any records of communication (such as dispatch logs, radio transmissions, or officer notes) pertaining to the response, arrest, and subsequent handling of each incident.

Copies of any audio or visual recordings, including but not limited to dashcam footage, body-worn camera footage, or surveillance footage, associated with the arrests in question.

Any available 911 audio recordings or transcripts related to the incidents.

Any written statements or interviews conducted by law enforcement officers or witnesses regarding the incidents.

Any records documenting the collection and preservation of physical evidence related to the arrests.

Copies of any arrest warrants, search warrants, or bench warrants issued in relation to the aforementioned charges.

To support my request, I refer to the following state and federal court cases that recognize the public's right to access court documents and law enforcement records under the Freedom of Information Act:

Nixon v. Warner Communications, Inc., 435 U.S. 589 (1978): This case affirmed the public's right to access court records under the common law and recognized the role of the media in informing the public.

Press-Enterprise Co. v. Superior Court, 478 U.S. 1 (1984): This case established that the public has a constitutional right under the First Amendment to attend criminal proceedings and access court documents.

Richmond Newspapers, Inc. v. Virginia, 448 U.S. 555 (1980): This case recognized the public's right of access to criminal trials under the First Amendment.

United States v. Mitchell, 551 F.2d 1252 (D.C. Cir. 1976): This case established that the public has a right of access to pretrial motions and exhibits.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document or recording is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.

If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: +1 845-218-0299

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

title: Request for Transparency in the Andrew James Smith Case

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Request for Transparency in the Andrew James Smith Case
communications.communication:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: July 8, 2023

Bucks County District Attorney's Office
55 East Court Street
Doylestown, PA 18901

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Records related to Andrew James Smith case

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the Bucks County District Attorney's Office pertaining to the case of Andrew James Smith, as reported in the article "HALFONT MAN SENTENCED FOR MAKING RACIST, THREATENING COMMENTS ON SOCIAL MEDIA VIDEO" on March 24th, 2021.

I request the following records:

Court Documents:
a) Charging documents: Please provide the complaint or indictment filed against Andrew James Smith, including any supporting affidavits or statements submitted.
b) Plea agreement: If applicable, please provide a copy of the plea agreement entered into between the prosecution and Andrew James Smith.
c) Sentencing memorandum: Please provide the sentencing memorandum prepared by the prosecution, which may include information regarding the sentencing recommendations and justifications.
d) Exhibits: If any exhibits were submitted during court proceedings, such as video evidence, photographs, or written statements, please provide copies of those exhibits.

Investigative Reports:
a) Reports by Bucks County Detectives: Please provide all investigative reports generated by Bucks County Detectives during their investigation of the case against Andrew James Smith.
b) Reports by Central Bucks Regional Police Department: Please provide all investigative reports generated by the Central Bucks Regional Police Department in connection with the case against Andrew James Smith.
c) Supplemental Reports: If any supplemental reports or updates were prepared during the investigation, please include copies of those reports as well.

Correspondence:
a) Correspondence with Victim's Family: Please provide copies of any emails, letters, or memoranda exchanged between the Bucks County District Attorney's Office and the victim's family regarding the case against Andrew James Smith.
b) Correspondence with Relevant Parties: If there was any correspondence between the Bucks County District Attorney's Office and other relevant parties, such as law enforcement agencies or expert witnesses, please include copies of those communications.

Racial Sensitivity Training Program:
a) Training Program Documents: Please provide any documents or records related to the racial sensitivity training program attended by Andrew James Smith at The Peace Center and Good Shepard Mediation as part of his sentence. This may include program syllabi, training materials, and attendance records.
b) Evaluations and Progress Reports: If available, please include any evaluations, progress reports, or certificates of completion associated with the racial sensitivity training program.

Additional Information:
a) Audio or Video Recordings: If any audio or video recordings were collected as part of the investigation or presented during court proceedings, please provide copies of those recordings.
b) Witness Statements: Please include copies of any witness statements obtained during the investigation.
c) Expert Opinions: If any expert opinions were sought or obtained in relation to the case, please provide copies of those opinions.
d) Evidence Inventory: If an inventory of evidence collected during the investigation was created, please include a copy of that inventory.

In accordance with the FOIA, I kindly request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions of the requested records, should any portion be deemed exempt from disclosure (5 U.S.C. § 552(b)). If an entire document is exempt, I kindly request a justification for withholding it, citing the specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

To support my request, I would like to cite several relevant state and federal case law that affirm the public's right to access government records under the FOIA:

Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989)
United States Department of State v. Ray, 502 U.S. 164 (1991)
Pennsylvania State Police v. McGill, 574 Pa. 574 (2003)
I firmly believe that the requested records are in the public interest and their disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I respectfully request a fee waiver for the processing of this request.

If the enclosed fee waiver request is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

I kindly request your response within twenty business days, as required by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i). Please provide the requested records in an electronic format, preferably by email or through a secure online portal, to expedite the process.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: +1 845-218-0299

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

title: Request for Dashcam Videos, Body-Worn Camera Footage, and Arrest Records of Nathan D. Taylor from East Lampeter Township Police

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Request for Dashcam Videos, Body-Worn Camera Footage, and Arrest Records of Nathan D. Taylor from East Lampeter Township Police
communications.communication:
East Lampeter Township Police Department
2250 Old Philadelphia Pike
Lancaster, PA 17602

Date: June 2, 2023

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Dashcam Videos, Body-Worn Camera Footage, and Additional Records

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, and in accordance with the Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law, 65 P.S. §§ 67.101-67.3104, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the East Lampeter Township Police Department pertaining to the arrest and charges of Nathan D. Taylor, as detailed in the incident described below:

Name: Nathan D. Taylor
Case/Arrest Number: 2304022940-35
Date of Arrest: April 9, 2023
Location of Arrest: 2100 block Lincoln Hwy East, Lancaster, PA 17602

For the purpose of this request, the records I seek include, but are not limited to:

Dashcam videos or any other video footage from police vehicles involved in the pursuit and arrest of Nathan D. Taylor on April 9, 2023.

Body-worn camera (BWC) footage worn by the arresting officers during the incident involving Nathan D. Taylor.

Incident reports, arrest reports, booking records, court documents, and any other relevant documents associated with the arrest and subsequent charges of Nathan D. Taylor. This includes any records related to the charges of Fleeing or Attempting to Elude Officer (M-2), Indecent Assault without Consent (M2), and Failure to Comply With Registration of Sexual Offender (F-2).

My request is made under the following laws:

The Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, which establishes the right of access to federal agency records, unless the requested records fall under one of the nine exemptions listed in the statute.

The Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law, 65 P.S. §§ 67.101-67.3104, which grants the public the right to access and obtain copies of records held by Commonwealth agencies, including law enforcement agencies, unless the requested records fall under the exceptions outlined in the law.

The Pennsylvania Criminal History Record Information Act (CHRIA), 18 Pa.C.S. § 9101 et seq., which governs the dissemination and access to criminal history record information, including the release of arrest and court records.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with the applicable laws. If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions or provisions of the Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law and CHRIA.

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA, the Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law, and CHRIA, and is subject to litigation.

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. Copies of any audio or video recordings, including but not limited to footage from surveillance cameras, body-worn cameras, or any other recording devices that captured the incident or its aftermath.

Any correspondence or communication, including emails, letters, memoranda, or other written exchanges, between the Village of Potsdam Police Department, the St. Lawrence County District Attorney's Office, the county Sheriff's Office, and the state Attorney General's Law Enforcement Misconduct Investigation Office regarding this incident.
Any court documents, including the appearance ticket issued to Matthew A. Seymour for Potsdam Town Court, and any subsequent court proceedings or rulings related to this incident.
Any documents related to the order of protection issued for the victim involved in this incident.
Any records, reports, or findings from the 2015 investigation into the fatal stabbing at Swan Landing involving Matthew A. Seymour and Tian Ma.
Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). Given the profound impact of Albert Fentress's crimes on the community and the ongoing interest in understanding the scope of his criminal activities, accessing these records will contribute significantly to the public's understanding of the operations and activities of the City of Poughkeepsie Police Department.

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of written and electronic complaints and challenges for removal, reclassification, or other reconsideration of the book Chik Chak Shabbat, by Mara Rockliff. from January 1, 2000 (or as early as available) to the present, as well as records, petitions, correspondence, and the outcomes related to these challenges. These are sometimes referred to as “book challenges.”

Victoria R. LoSchiavo

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Documentation and Evidence Related to the Criminal Case Against Karl Houston Walls (Anne Arundel County State's Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) to request access to and copies of all records and documents pertaining to the ongoing criminal case against Karl Houston Walls, a former teacher at Northeast High School in Pasadena, Anne Arundel County.

Mr. Walls has been charged with numerous criminal offenses, including but not limited to second-degree rape, cause to ingest bodily fluids, perverted practice, sexual solicitation of a minor, sex abuse of a minor, fourth-degree sex offense of a person of authority (4 counts), second-degree assault (three counts), dangerous weapon with intent to injure, fourth-degree sex offense by person of authority and second-degree assault.

The records sought include, but are not limited to, police reports, witness statements, charges filed, arrest records, court transcripts, evidence such as body cam video or interrogation footage, text messages and photographs/videos allegedly sent by Mr. Walls to the victims, and any other pertinent documents related to this case.

In addition, we are interested in any records relating to off-school property incidents involving Mr. Walls, specifically an incident where he allegedly held a knife against one of the students.

The public has a significant interest in these records due to the gravity of the charges and the involvement of a person in a position of authority over minors in a school setting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Concerned Citizen

3. Updated figures on the expenditure of the state's $50 million pledge for the CAURD program.
4. Details of the $5 million loan program announced in June 2023, including its source of funding.
5. The updated term sheet for Social Equity Impact Ventures' involvement in the Cannabis Social Equity Investment Fund, including details of the management fee.
6. All communications, contracts, and agreements related to the selection of Chicago Atlantic as the investor for the Cannabis Social Equity Investment Fund.
7. Any records related to the questions listed in the article "The questions DASNY will not answer about NY cannabis" published on Syracuse.com.

Please note that according to the New York State Archives' General Retention and Disposition Schedule for New York State Government Records (LGS-01), many of these records should be retained and available for public access.

title: Internal Communications

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Internal Communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to view any emails, Microsoft Teams communications, or other interoffice communications from the Executive Director to staff addressing AREC's official policy directives regarding employee sick leave, vacation, and compensation from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Tony Fritz.
